tool_description: Foxello FakePro is your go-to API for generating realistic and diverse fake data, perfect for testing and development purposes.
name: FakerPro
title: FakerPro

api_list.name: Category
api_list.description:
Now that you've explored the available data categories using the **/list** endpoint, it's time to fetch the data you desire. Make a second API call to GET **/{category}**, where **{category}** should be replaced with your chosen data category's name from the list. For example, if you want to generate random characters, use GET **/character**. If it's a boolean value you need, use GET **/bool**. This straightforward approach ensures you get precisely the data you want for your application or creative endeavor.

Additionally, some data categories support customization through query parameters. Refer to the "properties" object in the list response to determine which parameters are available and their data types. You can tailor your API call by including these parameters to obtain data that precisely fits your requirements. This straightforward approach ensures you get the specific data you want for your application or creative endeavor.

Feel free to use these calls to efficiently access the data you require for your projects.

api_list.name: List
api_list.description: This initial call returns a comprehensive JSON list containing a diverse range of random data categories. These categories cover a wide array of data types, from boolean values and characters to numbers, names, and more. This list serves as your reference guide for selecting the specific data category you need for your project.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://fakerpro.p.rapidapi.com/list"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "fakerpro.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://fakerpro.p.rapidapi.com/list"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "fakerpro.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
